question:
Which of the following is an n-type semiconductor?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Silicon
B. Diamond
C. Silicon carbide
D. Arsenic-doped silicon
Answer:

Calculate the magnetic moment (μI) of a 13C nucleus.
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 6.1445 x 10^-27 J T-1
B. 3.1445 x 10^-27 J T-1
C. 9.1445 x 10^-27 J T-1
D. 1.1445 x 10^-28 J T-1
Answer:

Considering 0.1 M aqueous solutions of each of the following, which solution has the lowest pH?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Na2CO3
B. Na3PO4
C. Na2S
D. NaCl
Answer:

What is the limiting high-temperature molar heat capacity at constant volume (C_V) of a gas-phase diatomic molecule?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 1.5R
B. 2R
C. 2.5R
D. 3.5R
Answer:

What is the magnetic moment of 205Tl?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. [ɣ (205TI = 1.569 x 108 T-1 s-1, I = ½]
B. 0.717 x 10^-26 J T-1
C. 0.827 x 10^-26 J T-1
D. 1.433 x 10^-26 J T-1
Answer:

The 99Ru chemical shift of [Ru(H2O)6]2+ is 16,050 ppm relative to [Ru(CN)6]2- at 0 ppm. The electronic excitation energies of [Ru(H2O)6]2+, [Ru(CN)6]2- and [Ru(NH3)6]2+ are 18,900, 40,000 and 25,600 cm-1 respectively. Assuming that the chemical shift differences are dominated by paramagnetic currents, determine the chemical shift of [Ru(NH3)6]2+.
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 7,530 ppm
B. 8,090 ppm
C. 11,070 ppm
D. 14,840 ppm
Answer:

Which of the following metal ions cannot be used as a paramagnetic quencher?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Ti3+
B. Cr3+
C. Fe3+
D. Zn2+
Answer:

Which of the following statements most accurately explains why the T1 of a nucleus is sometimes longer than its T2?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. T1, unlike T2, is sensitive to very low-frequency molecular motions.
B. T2, unlike T1, is sensitive to very low-frequency molecular motions.
C. T1, unlike T2, is sensitive to molecular motions at the Larmor frequency.
D. T2, unlike T1, is sensitive to molecular motions at the Larmor frequency.
Answer:

What is the strength (B1) of a 13C 90° pulse of duration 1 μs?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 3.72 mT
B. 5.18 mT
C. 17.0 mT
D. 23.3 mT
Answer:

In fluorescence spectroscopy, the quantum yield (Φ_f) is best defined as the
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. rate of fluorescence emission
B. number of photons emitted
C. number of photons emitted, divided by the number of photons absorbed
D. number of excitation photons impinging on the sample, divided by the number of photons absorbed
Answer:

During a delay, spins with an offset frequency Ω = 250 rad s-1 precess through an angle of 60°. How long is the delay?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 4.19 ms
B. 26.3 ms
C. 240 ms
D. 1510 ms
Answer:

Which of the following compounds has a 1H resonance approximately 1.55 kHz away from TMS on a spectrometer with a 12.0 T magnet?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. CH3F
B. CH3Cl
C. CH3Br
D. CH3I
Answer:

The 1H spectrum of a mixture of dimethylsulphoxide (DMSO) and acetonitrile (AN) contains lines with relative intensities α and 3α, respectively. What is the ratio of the two concentrations, [DMSO]:[AN]?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 1:1
B. 1:3
C. 1:6
D. 2:3
Answer:

What is the ratio of line intensities in the EPR spectrum of the t-Bu radical (CH3)3C•?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 1:19:36:84:126:126:84:36:19:1
B. 1:9:36:84:126:126:84:36:9:1
C. 1:9:35:82:120:120:82:35:9:1
D. 1:8:28:56:70:56:28:8:1
Answer:

Which one sentence explains most accurately why spin trapping is often used to detect free radical intermediates?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. spin trapping provides more structural information than direct detection by EPR
B. spin trapping makes it easy to quantify free radical intermediates
C. steady state concentration of free radical intermediates is often too low to enable direct detection by EPR
D. detection of spin adducts requires lower power than direct detection of radical intermediates
Answer:

What is the orbital angular momentum quantum number, l, of the electron that is most easily removed when ground-state aluminum is ionized?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 3
B. 2
C. 1
D. 0
Answer:

The 1H Larmor frequency of benzene exceeds that of trifluoroacetic acid by 1.656 kHz on a 400 MHz spectrometer. The 1H chemical shift of benzene is 7.16 ppm. What is the chemical shift of trifluoroacetic acid?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 3.02 ppm
B. 5.03 ppm
C. 10.56 ppm
D. 11.30 ppm
Answer:

For EDTA titrations, the analyte solution and the titrant solution are both buffered at the same pH for which of the following reasons?
I. The conditional formation constant is affected by pH.
II. The fraction of EDTA in the fully deprotonated Y4− form varies with pH.
III. When EDTA reacts to form a metal complex, H+ is a product in most cases.
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. I only
B. I and II only
C. I and III only
D. I, II, and III
Answer:

Which of the following procedures tend(s) to minimize the influence of random errors on measured results?
I. Signal averaging
II. Use of internal standards
III. Averaging the results from multiple samples
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. I only
B. II only
C. III only
D. I and III only
Answer:

Calculate the spin angular momentum of 43Ca. [I = 7⁄2]
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 2.166 x 10^-34 J s
B. 3.691 x 10^-34 J s
C. 4.185 x 10^-34 J s
D. 5.493 x 10^-34 J s
Answer:

A radioactive isotope, which is used in diagnostic imaging, has a half-life of 6.0 hours. If a quantity of this isotope has an activity of 150 mCi when it is delivered to a hospital, how much activity will remain 24 hours after delivery? (mCi = microcuries)
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 150 mCi
B. 38 mCi
C. 19 mCi
D. 9.4 mCi
Answer:

Of the following compounds, which is LEAST likely to behave as a Lewis acid?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. BeCl2
B. MgCl2
C. ZnCl2
D. SCl2
Answer:

Calculate the magnetic field responsible for the polarization of 2.5 x 10^-6 for 13C at 298 K.
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 0.5 T
B. 1.2 T
C. 2.9 T
D. 100 T
Answer:

A PO3- radical produces a pair of lines separated by 280 MHz with giso = 2.005. Calculate the expected resonant field positions of both lines in the X-band EPR spectrum (ν = 9.5 GHz).
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Bres for mI = -½ = 325.0 mT; Bres for mI = +½ = 335.0 mT
B. Bres for mI = -½ = 123.5 mT; Bres for mI = +½ = 124.5 mT.
C. Bres for mI = -½ = 333.5 mT; Bres for mI = +½ = 343.5 mT.
D. Bres for mI = -½ = 0.218 mT; Bres for mI = +½ = 0.418 mT.
Answer:

Nitronyl nitroxides are stable radicals in which the unpaired electron is coupled to two equivalent nitrogen nuclei. How many lines will appear in the EPR spectrum of a solution of a rigid nitronyl nitroxide diradical with J >> a?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 3 lines
B. 9 lines
C. 5 lines
D. 7 lines
Answer:

Which of the following is required for both paramagnetism and ferromagnetism?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Strong oxidizing conditions
B. Low-spin electron configuration
C. Metallic physical properties
D. Unpaired electrons
Answer:

Which of the following is lower for argon than for neon?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Melting point
B. Boiling point
C. Polarizability
D. First ionization energy
Answer:

Which of the following types of spectroscopy is a light-scattering technique?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Nuclear magnetic resonance
B. Infrared
C. Raman
D. Ultraviolet-visible
Answer:

Which one of the following statements is true:
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Large and positive g shifts are observed when the LUMO – HOMO gap is small and λ is positive.
B. Large deviations in g occurs when the energy difference between the SOMO and lowest lying excited state is large.
C. A large deviation of g from ge is expected when λ is large and the energy difference between the SOMO and the lowest lying excited state is small.
D. A small deviation of g from ge is expected when λ is small and positive.
Answer:

Of the following compounds, which has the lowest melting point?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. HCl
B. AgCl
C. CaCl2
D. CCl4
Answer:

When the Heisenberg uncertainty principle is applied to a quantum mechanical particle in the lowest energy level of a one-dimensional box, which of the following is true?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Momentum is known exactly, but no information about position can be known.
B. Position is known exactly, but no information about momentum can be known.
C. No information about either position or momentum can be known.
D. Neither position nor momentum can be known exactly.
Answer:

What is the NMR frequency of 31P in a 20.0 T magnetic field?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 54.91 MHz
B. 239.2 MHz
C. 345.0 MHz
D. 2167 MHz
Answer:

An electron and a proton are placed in a 1.0 T magnetic field at 300 K. What is the ratio of the equilibrium polarizations: |pe / pH| ?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. [|ɣe| = 1.761 x 10^11 T^-1 s^-1]
B. 820
C. 658
D. 329
Answer:

Redox enzyme catalysis involves the cyclic oxidation and reduction of metal ions that have at least two stable positive oxidation states. Which of the following groups of metals could be found at the active site of redox enzymes?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Cu, Fe, Co
B. Zn, Ca, Ga
C. Sr, Ga, Mg
D. Na, Ba, Al
Answer:

Which of the following is the most common naturally-occurring form in which silicon is found?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Metallic element
B. Sulfide
C. Fluoride
D. Oxide
Answer:

In the vibrational-rotational spectrum of a diatomic molecule, the R-branch of the spectrum is the result of which of the following transitions?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. ΔJ = 0; Δu = 0
B. ΔJ = 1; Δu = 0
C. ΔJ = 2; Δu = 0
D. ΔJ = 1; Δu = 1
Answer:

At 25°C, the maximum amount of PbI2 that can be dissolved in 1.00 L of pure water is 1.0 mmol. Assuming complete dissociation, the solubility product, K_sp, for lead iodide at 25°C is
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 1.0 × 10^−3
B. 1.0 × 10^−6
C. 1.0 × 10^−9
D. 4.0 × 10^−9
Answer:

The equation ΔH = ΔU + PΔV is applicable
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. always
B. only for constant pressure processes
C. only for constant temperature processes
D. only for constant volume processes
Answer:

The dissociation energy for a hydrogen-bromine bond is defined as the change in enthalpy, DH, for which of the following reactions?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 2 HBr(g) → H2(g) + Br2(l)
B. HBr(g) → H+(g) + Br−(g)
C. H(g) + Br(g) → HBr(g)
D. HBr(g) → H(g) + Br(g)
Answer:

The amplitude of a free induction decay drops to 25% of its initial intensity after 1.0 s. Assuming exponential relaxation and Ω = 0, determine the value of T2.
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 0.721 s
B. 0.750 s
C. 1.386 s
D. 1.661 s
Answer:

23Na has an NMR frequency of 198.52 MHz in a 750 MHz NMR spectrometer. What is its magnetogyric ratio?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 101.1 x 10^7 T-1 s-1
B. 26.75 x 10^7 T-1 s-1
C. 7.081 x 10^7 T-1 s-1
D. 0.9377 x 10^7 T-1 s-1
Answer:

Exact solutions of the Schrödinger equation CANNOT be obtained for a
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. simple harmonic oscillator
B. particle in a one-dimensional box
C. rigid rotor
D. helium atom
Answer:

The rotational correlation time of a spherical object of radius r immersed in a liquid with viscosity η is given by the Stokes equation: τc = 4πηr3/3kBT. A small molecule with relative molecular mass Mr = 100 in water at 298 K has τc = 50 ps. Assuming that Mr is proportional to the molecular volume, estimate τc for a small protein with Mr = 8400.
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 420 ns
B. 42 ns
C. 4.2 ns
D. 420 ps
Answer:

Which of the following is classified as a conjugate acid-base pair?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. HCl / NaOH
B. H3O+ / H2O
C. O2 / H2O
D. H+ / Cl−
Answer:

A silyl radical bearing an Si-H· fragment has a g value of 2.0033 and a pair of lines separated by 15.5 MHz. Express the splitting in units of mT, Gauss and cm-1.
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 15.5 MHz = 11.104 mT = 27.201 Gauss = 0.862 x 10^-4 cm-1
B. 15.5 MHz = 7.352 mT = 10.104 Gauss = 18.39 x 10^-4 cm-1
C. 15.5 MHz = 1.55 mT = 0.562 Gauss = 31.0 x 10^-4 cm-1
D. 15.5 MHz = 0.553 mT = 5.530 Gauss = 5.17 x 10^-4 cm-1
Answer:

Predict the hyperfine value for the EPR spectrum of fully deuteriated benzene radical anion C6D6•-.
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 0.375 mT
B. 3.75 G
C. 2.35 mT
D. 0.58 G
Answer:

On the basis of oxidation-reduction potential, which of the following is most likely to occur?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Al(s) + 3 NaNO3(aq) 3 Na(s) + Al(NO3)3(aq)
B. Zn(s) + 2 Ag(NO3)(aq) → 2 Ag(s) + Zn(NO3)2(aq)
C. Pb(s) + Ca(NO3)2(aq) → Ca(s) + Pb(NO3)2(aq)
D. Pb(s) + 2 LiNO3(aq) → 2 Li(s) + Pb(NO3)2(aq)
Answer:

The 13C spectrum of which isomer of C6H14 has lines with five distinct chemical shifts?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. hexane
B. 2-methylpentane
C. 3-methylpentane
D. 2,3-dimethylbutane
Answer:

A buffer is made from equal concentrations of a weak acid and its conjugate base. Doubling the volume of the buffer solution by adding water has what effect on its pH?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. It has little effect.
B. It significantly increases the pH.
C. It significantly decreases the pH.
D. It changes the pH asymptotically to the pKa of the acid.
Answer:

Calculate the relative occupancies of the α and β spin energy levels for a radical species with g = 2.05, at L- and W-band frequencies (take TS = 300 K).
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Nα/Nβ = 0.9800 at L-band; Nα/Nβ = 0.9509 at W-band
B. Nα/Nβ = 0.9950 at L-band; Nα/Nβ = 0.9609 at W-band
C. Nα/Nβ = 0.9910 at L-band; Nα/Nβ = 0.9709 at W-band
D. Nα/Nβ = 0.9850 at L-band; Nα/Nβ = 0.9809 at W-band
Answer:
